page.title: 19Traffic Survey 3
page.content:
The results for the main Lyndhurst Road were: {Cars}375 per 45 minutes {Lorries}37 per 45 minutes {Motor Bikes}21 per 45 minutes {Buses}3 per 45 minutes {Bicycles}8 per 45 minutes {Pedestrians}78 per 45 minutes {Cars with Caravans}43 per 45 minutes
The conclusions of the survey briefly were : {Tourism}is a major factor in the heavy traffic,especially with the caravans. Many villagers use {Bicycle} as a means of transport. The village is not well served by {Public {Transport. Primary Pupils and College {Students}increased the number of { {Pedestrians}recorded.{Motor Bikes} tended to be recorded in groups not individually.
